intro: Thyrsanthus diospyrifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaved thyrsanthus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant features palmate leaves with a distinctive lobed shape, and its stems are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It typically grows in forest margins and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils and partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
